intro: Pedicularis grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has striking red or pink spurred flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often hairy, while its stems are erect and can reach up to 1 meter in height. Pedicularis grandiflora is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
